title: Architectural Improvements & Codebase Leveling
description:
Epic to address architectural issues and level up the Neo CLI codebase.

## Analysis Summary

Based on deep codebase analysis, several architectural improvements are needed:

### Test Coverage (~15-20% overall)
- Most commands have <10% coverage
- Storage layer has 0% coverage
- Utility functions have inconsistent coverage

### Interface Implementation Gap
- ILogger interface defined but logger.ts doesn't implement it
- IPlugin system defined but no implementation exists
- DI container interface defined but not implemented
- ICommand interface defined but commands use Commander directly
- IEventBus interface defined but no event system exists

### Error Handling Inconsistency
- Commands use process.exit() instead of Result<T> pattern
- Error handling duplicated across git commands
- Recovery strategies defined but not integrated

### Code Quality Issues
- Mixed sync/async patterns in db.ts
- Duplicate error handling logic in push/pull commands
- Config validation not using Zod schemas consistently

## Goals
- Increase test coverage to >80%
- Implement defined interfaces
- Adopt Result type pattern consistently
- Extract shared error handling to utilities

title: Increase test coverage to 80%+
description:
Current test coverage is very low:
- cli.ts: 12%
- Commands: 1-28% (most under 10%)

2. Add integration tests for git commands
3. Add unit tests for storage/db.ts
4. Add tests for configuration management
5. Set up coverage thresholds in CI

## Acceptance Criteria
- All files have >80% line coverage
- CI fails if coverage drops below threshold
- Critical paths have 100% coverage

title: Fix priority ordering in ContextDB.listContexts()
description:
The listContexts() method in storage/db.ts orders by priority using text sorting, which doesn't match semantic priority ordering.

## Current Behavior
SQL query uses: `ORDER BY priority DESC, created_at DESC`

Text sorting produces: medium > low > high > critical (alphabetical)

## Expected Behavior
Semantic priority order: critical > high > medium > low

## Proposed Fix
Use a CASE statement to map priority strings to numeric values:

```sql
ORDER BY CASE priority
  WHEN 'critical' THEN 4
  WHEN 'high' THEN 3
  WHEN 'medium' THEN 2
  WHEN 'low' THEN 1
  ELSE 0
END DESC, created_at DESC
```

## Found During
Test coverage work for neo-4uf.1. Test adjusted to current behavior with TODO comment.

title: Implement ILogger interface in logger.ts
description:
The ILogger interface is defined in core/interfaces but logger.ts uses a custom Logger class that doesn't implement it.

## Current State
- logger.ts has: info, success, warn, error, debug, log, setVerbose
- ILogger expects: debug, info, warn, error, success, log, setLevel, getLevel with context support

## Tasks
1. Update Logger class to implement ILogger interface
2. Add context parameter support to all log methods
3. Implement proper log level management
4. Add structured logging capability
5. Consider adding log formatters

## Benefits
- Consistent logging across the application
- Enables future log output customization
- Better testability with mock loggers

title: Adopt Result<T> pattern for error handling
Extract shared git error handling utilities
description:
Error handling code is duplicated across git commands (push, pull, commit, branch).

## Duplicated Patterns
- 'not a git repository' detection
- Authentication failure handling
- Network/remote errors
- Conflict detection
- Upstream branch checks

## Solution
Create a shared git error handler utility:
```typescript
// utils/git-errors.ts
export function handleGitError(error: unknown): Result<never, GitError> {
  // Centralized git error detection and handling
}
```

## Tasks
1. Audit all git commands for error handling patterns
2. Create GitError subclass of AppError
3. Create git-errors.ts utility module
4. Refactor push command to use shared utility
5. Refactor pull command to use shared utility
6. Refactor commit/branch commands

## Benefits
- DRY principle
- Consistent error messages
- Easier to add new git error types
- Better maintenance
close_reason: Implemented shared git error handling utilities in src/utils/git-errors.ts. PR #68.

title: Implement basic plugin system
description:
IPlugin and IPluginContext interfaces are defined but no implementation exists.

## Defined Interfaces
- IPlugin: Plugin metadata, commands, lifecycle hooks
- IPluginContext: version, config, logger, eventBus, commandRegistry
- ILifecycleHooks: beforeCommand, afterCommand, onError, onExit

## Implementation Plan
1. Create PluginLoader to discover/load plugins
2. Create PluginRegistry to manage plugins
3. Implement lifecycle hook system
4. Add plugin configuration support
5. Create plugin API for extensions

## Plugin Discovery Options
- ~/.config/neo/plugins/ directory
- npm packages with 'neo-plugin-' prefix
- Local file plugins

## MVP Scope
- Load local plugins from config directory
- Basic lifecycle hooks (beforeCommand, afterCommand)
- Plugin commands registration

## Future Enhancements
- npm plugin installation
- Plugin marketplace
- Plugin dependencies
- Hot reload

title: Implement IEventBus for decoupled communication
description:
IEventBus interface is defined for inter-component communication but not implemented.

## Interface
```typescript
interface IEventBus {
  emit<T>(event: string, data?: T): void;
  on<T>(event: string, handler: EventHandler<T>): void;
  off<T>(event: string, handler: EventHandler<T>): void;
  once<T>(event: string, handler: EventHandler<T>): void;
}
```

## Use Cases
- Plugin lifecycle events
- Command execution events
- Config change notifications
- Error propagation
- Analytics/telemetry events

## Tasks
1. Create EventBus class implementing IEventBus
2. Add typed event definitions
3. Integrate with CLI lifecycle
4. Add to PluginContext
5. Document event types

## Benefits
- Loose coupling between components
- Enables plugins to react to events
- Better extensibility
- Easier testing with mock event bus

title: Refactor commands to use ICommand interface
Implement basic dependency injection container
description:
IContainer interface is defined but no DI implementation exists.

## Interface
```typescript
interface IContainer {
  register<T>(token: InjectionToken<T>, provider: Provider<T>): void;
  resolve<T>(token: InjectionToken<T>): T;
  has<T>(token: InjectionToken<T>): boolean;
  createScope(): IContainer;
}
```

## Use Cases
- Injectable services (logger, config, http client)
- Mock injection for testing
- Plugin dependency resolution
- Scoped instances per command

## Tasks
1. Create simple Container class
2. Add singleton and transient lifetimes
3. Register core services (logger, config)
4. Update commands to use DI
5. Document DI usage patterns

## Considerations
- Keep it simple - avoid over-engineering
- Consider using existing library (tsyringe, inversify)
- Start with manual registration, add decorators later

## Priority
P4 as this is foundational but not immediately critical. Can be implemented incrementally.

title: New Feature Ideas & Capabilities
description:
Epic for brainstorming and implementing new features for Neo CLI.

## Feature Categories

### Git Workflow Enhancements
- Interactive stash management (stash list, apply, pop with UI)
- Cherry-pick with interactive commit selection
- Interactive rebase helper with conflict resolution UI
- Branch comparison and diff visualization
- Git worktree management

### GitHub Integration
- Create pull requests directly from CLI
- View and manage PR comments
- Issue creation and linking
- PR status and CI checks dashboard
- Automatic PR templates

### Configuration & Profiles
- Config profiles (dev, work, personal)
- Project-specific overrides
- Configuration export/import
- Configuration wizard for first-time setup

### Safety & Undo
- Command history with undo capability
- Dry-run mode for all destructive commands
- Confirmation prompts for dangerous operations
- Backup system for destructive operations

### Shell Integration
- Enhanced shell completions (bash, zsh, fish)
- Command suggestions based on context
- Git alias suggestions
- Shell hooks for notifications

### Plugin System
- Plugin discovery and installation
- Plugin marketplace/registry
- Plugin API for third-party extensions
- Plugin templates for development

### AI/Agent Enhancements
- Context-aware commit message generation
- Code review suggestions
- Branch naming suggestions
- Automated changelog generation

### UI/UX Improvements
- Terminal themes (light, dark, custom)
- Interactive dashboards
- Progress bars for long operations
- Rich diff viewer

## Goals
- Prioritize features based on user feedback
- Build incrementally with minimal viable implementations
- Maintain backward compatibility

title: Interactive git stash management
description:
Add interactive stash management commands to Neo CLI.

## Commands
- `neo git stash` - Save changes to stash with interactive naming
- `neo git stash list` - Show stashes with interactive selection
- `neo git stash apply` - Apply stash with conflict resolution UI
- `neo git stash pop` - Pop stash with confirmation
- `neo git stash drop` - Drop stash with confirmation

## Features
- Visual stash list with timestamps and descriptions
- Interactive stash selection with preview
- Conflict detection before apply
- Partial stash support (select files to stash)
- Stash search by content/message

## UI/UX
- Use inquirer for stash selection
- Show diff preview before apply
- Clear confirmation for destructive operations
- Success/failure feedback with next steps
close_reason: Implemented interactive git stash management with save, list, show, apply, pop, and drop subcommands

title: GitHub PR creation from CLI
description:
Create pull requests directly from Neo CLI.

## Command
`neo gh pr create` or `neo pr`

## Features
- Auto-detect base branch (main/master/develop)
- Generate PR title from branch name or commits
- Template support (PR_TEMPLATE.md)
- Draft PR support
- Reviewer assignment
- Label assignment
- Milestone selection
- Link to issues (closes #123)

## Flow
1. Check for unpushed commits → prompt to push
2. Detect/select base branch
3. Generate title suggestion
4. Open editor for description (or use template)
5. Select reviewers (optional)
6. Create PR and show URL

## Integration
- Use gh CLI under the hood
- Fall back to GitHub API if gh not available
- Cache user preferences (default reviewers, etc.)

## Dependencies
- gh CLI installed OR GitHub token configured
close_reason: Implemented GitHub PR creation from CLI with neo gh pr create command and neo pr alias. Features include auto-detection of base branch, title generation, PR template support, draft PRs, reviewer/label assignment, unpushed commits handling, and comprehensive error handling. 8 unit tests added.

title: Configuration profiles support
description:
Support multiple configuration profiles for different contexts.

## Use Cases
- Work vs personal projects
- Different git identities
- Client-specific configurations
- Development vs production settings

## Commands
- `neo config profile list` - List profiles
- `neo config profile create <name>` - Create new profile
- `neo config profile use <name>` - Switch active profile
- `neo config profile delete <name>` - Delete profile
- `neo config profile export <name>` - Export profile
- `neo config profile import <file>` - Import profile

## Features
- Profile-specific git user.name/email
- Profile-specific preferences
- Auto-switch based on directory patterns
- Profile inheritance (base + overrides)
- Per-project profile (.neorc)

## Storage
- ~/.config/neo/profiles/<name>.json
- ~/.config/neo/config.json tracks active profile

## Auto-Switch Rules
```json
{
  "autoSwitch": {
    "~/work/*": "work",
    "~/personal/*": "personal"
  }
}
```
close_reason: Implemented configuration profiles support with ProfileManager class and neo config profile commands (list, create, use, delete, show, export, import). Features include auto-switch based on directory patterns, profile copying, and seamless migration. 16 unit tests added.

title: AI-powered commit message generation
description:
Generate commit messages using AI based on staged changes.

## Command
`neo git commit --ai` or `neo commit`

## Features
- Analyze staged diff
- Generate conventional commit message
- Support multiple providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, local)
- Learn from repository commit history
- Multi-language support
- Edit before committing

## Flow
1. Check for staged changes
2. Get diff of staged files
3. Send to AI with context (recent commits, branch name)
4. Generate commit message
5. Show preview with edit option
6. Commit with final message

## Configuration
```json
{
  "ai": {
    "provider": "anthropic",
    "model": "claude-3-haiku",
    "style": "conventional",
    "maxTokens": 100
  }
}
```

## Privacy
- Option to redact sensitive file paths
- Local-only mode option
- Clear data handling documentation

title: Interactive rebase helper
description:
Provide an interactive UI for git rebase operations.

## Command
`neo git rebase` or `neo rebase`

## Features
- Visual commit list with reorder capability
- Squash commits with combined message editing
- Drop commits with confirmation
- Edit commit messages
- Conflict resolution with visual merge tool
- Abort/continue/skip with clear status

## UI Flow
1. Show commit list since divergence
2. Allow reordering (up/down arrows)
3. Mark commits for squash/edit/drop
4. Execute rebase with progress
5. Handle conflicts interactively
6. Show final result

## Conflict Resolution
- Show conflicting files
- Open in preferred editor
- Mark resolved/unresolved
- Continue when all resolved

## Safety
- Warn about pushed commits
- Create backup branch before rebase
- Clear undo instructions

title: Terminal themes support
description:
Add customizable terminal themes for Neo CLI.

## Current State
- Fixed color palette in ui-types.ts
- 4 semantic colors (primary, success, error, muted)
- Icons defined in Icons object

## Features
- Built-in themes (dark, light, high-contrast, dracula, nord, etc.)
- Custom theme creation
- Per-terminal detection (dark/light)
- Color-blind friendly options
- Icon sets (unicode, ASCII, emoji, nerd-fonts)

## Theme Structure
```json
{
  "name": "dracula",
  "colors": {
    "primary": "#bd93f9",
    "success": "#50fa7b",
    "error": "#ff5555",
    "muted": "#6272a4"
  },
  "icons": {
    "success": "✓",
    "error": "✖",
    "warning": "⚠",
    "info": "ℹ"
  }
}
```

## Commands
- `neo config set theme <name>`
- `neo config theme preview`
- `neo config theme list`

title: Command history with undo capability
description:
Track command history and enable undo for destructive operations.

## Features
- Log all Neo commands with timestamps
- Store pre/post state for undoable operations
- Undo last command or specific command
- View command history

## Undoable Operations
- git push → git push --force with previous HEAD
- git commit → git reset HEAD~1 --soft
- config set → restore previous value
- branch delete → restore from reflog

## Commands
- `neo history` - View command history
- `neo undo` - Undo last operation
- `neo undo <id>` - Undo specific operation
- `neo history clear` - Clear history

## Storage
- ~/.config/neo/history.db (SQLite)
- Automatic pruning (keep last 1000 commands)
- Sensitive data redaction

## UI
- Show what will be undone before executing
- Require confirmation for undo
- Show success/failure status

title: Enhanced shell completions
description:
Comprehensive shell completions for bash, zsh, and fish.

## Current State

- Zsh-focused implementation
- 0% test coverage

## Features
- Dynamic completion based on context
- Branch name completion for git commands
- Remote name completion
- Config key completion
- Subcommand completion

## Shell Support
- Bash: Complete script with _neo function
- Zsh: Completion with _neo and compdef
- Fish: fish_complete_path integration

## Dynamic Completions
- `neo git checkout <TAB>` → list local branches

## Commands
- `neo completions bash` - Output bash completions
- `neo completions zsh` - Output zsh completions
- `neo completions fish` - Output fish completions
- `neo completions install` - Auto-install for current shell

title: Git worktree management
description:
Manage git worktrees with an intuitive interface.

## What are Worktrees?
Git worktrees allow checking out multiple branches simultaneously in separate directories. Useful for:
- Working on multiple features
- Reviewing PRs while keeping current work
- Running tests on different branches

## Commands
- `neo git worktree list` - List all worktrees
- `neo git worktree add <branch>` - Create worktree for branch
- `neo git worktree remove <path>` - Remove worktree
- `neo git worktree switch` - Interactive worktree switcher

## Features
- Auto-naming based on branch
- Create in ~/.neo/worktrees/<repo>/<branch>
- Open in new terminal/tmux pane
- Clone worktree with same remote setup
- Status dashboard showing all worktrees

## Integration
- Show worktree indicator in prompt
- Quick switch between worktrees
- Cleanup stale worktrees
